titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I had much talk with Clarence on the many subjects on which he is keen, walked with him, & took him to dine at the Castle. Here was a pleasant party â€“ Gee with Quirk & Cruickshank as his guests, myself & Clarence, & the chaplain. Our talk was fast & furious round the venerable mahogany of that glorious common–room. Returning to the Deanery, Clarence read aloud Halifax's Character of Charles II, an admirable piece: & then we talked on till long after midnight on the mighty & embarrassing theme of Religion.
